trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> class represents a subnet in a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Forest"></xref>.

Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> class, using the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object and subnet name.

A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object that specifies the context for this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the name of the subnet.
context specifies a configuration set, but no AD LDS instance was found.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:
- context does not refer a valid forest, configuration set, domain controller, or AD LDS server.
- subnetName is an empty string.
context or subnetName is `null`.
The credentials that were supplied are not valid.

Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> class, using the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object, subnet name, and site name.

A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object that specifies the context for this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the name of the subnet.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the name of the site that contains the subnet.
context specifies a configuration set, but no AD LDS instance was found.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:
- context does not refer to a valid forest, configuration set, domain controller, or AD LDS server.
- subnetName or siteName is an empty string.
context, subnetName, or siteName is `null`.
The credentials that were supplied are not valid.
Deletes the subnet that is represented by this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object has not yet been saved in the Active Directory Domain Services store.
The object has been disposed.
The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.
Releases all resources that are used by the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object and optionally releases the managed resources.
`true` if the managed resources should be released; `false` if only the unmanaged resources should be released.
Returns a subnet that is based on a subnet name.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext"></xref> object that is valid for this subnet.
The name of the subnet to find.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> for the requested subnet.
In the context parameter that was specified, the site could not be found for the given subnetName parameter.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
This exception will occur for any of the following reasons:
The target in the context parameter is not a forest, configuration set, domain controller, or AD LDS server.
- subnetName is an empty string.
context or subnetName is `null`.
Gets the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryEntry"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object has not yet been saved in the Active Directory Domain Services store.
The object has been disposed.
Gets or sets the location description of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
The location description of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The object has been disposed.
Gets the subnet name of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
The name of the subnet.
The object has been disposed.
Writes any changes to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object to the Active Directory Domain Services store.
The subnet object already exists.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
The object has been disposed.
The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.
Gets or sets the site that the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object is a member of.

An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySite"></xref> object for the site that the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object is a member of.
Applies to set only.
The specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySite"></xref> object does not exist.
If it was newly created, it must be committed to the directory store before assigning it to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectorySubnet"></xref> object.
The object has been disposed.
Returns the name of the subnet.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the name of the subnet.
The object has been disposed.
